documentQueue.description: This document can be automatically processed to benefit all users.
benefits: Available for all users without manual download
Fully processed and optimized for search
Contributes to the growth of Mexican legal corpus
steps: You submit a document request with the official URL
The document is added to the processing queue
GitHub Actions automatically processes documents weekly
The document becomes available in the next site update

wiki.title: Mexican Law Wiki
wiki.subtitle: Learn about the Mexican legal system, from basic concepts to complex processes.

introduction.title: Introduction to Mexican Law
introduction.paragraph1: The Mexican legal system is a civil law system based on written codes, with influence from Roman-Germanic law. The Political Constitution of the United Mexican States is the supreme law that establishes the fundamental principles of the State and citizens' rights.
introduction.paragraph2: This wiki will guide you through fundamental concepts, government structure, legislative and judicial processes, and provide resources to better understand Mexico's legal framework.

civilLaw.title: Civil Law
civilLaw.description: System based on written codes that regulate relationships between individuals.

commonVsCivil.title: Common Law vs Civil Law
commonVsCivil.description: Unlike common law, Mexican law is based on codified laws.

hierarchy.title: Normative Hierarchy
hierarchy.item1: Political Constitution of the United Mexican States

glossary.title: Legal Glossary
glossary.noTermsFound: No terms found matching your search.

amparo.definition: Constitutional trial that protects people's fundamental rights against acts of authority that violate them.

jurisprudencia.definition: Court interpretation of law established through five uninterrupted enforceable judgments without any contrary ruling.

personaMoral.definition: Legal entity distinct from natural persons, capable of acquiring rights and contracting obligations.

debidoProceso.definition: Fundamental right that guarantees every person access to a fair, impartial procedure with all legal guarantees.

contratoTrabajo.definition: Agreement whereby a person undertakes to provide subordinate personal work to another in exchange for salary payment.

delito.definition: Act or omission sanctioned by criminal laws, which must be typical, unlawful, and culpable.

obligacionTributaria.definition: Legal bond whereby the taxpayer must pay the State a sum of money as a tax.

sociedadMercantil.definition: Legal entity established in accordance with the General Law of Commercial Companies, for profit purposes.

initiative.title: 1. Initiative
initiative.description: Presentation of the bill by authorized parties
details: The project is presented in writing to one of the chambers
Must include statement of reasons and articles

committee.title: 2. Committee Review
committee.description: Analysis and modification of the project by committees

discussion.title: 3. Discussion
discussion.description: Debate in plenary session of the Chamber of Origin

approval.title: 4. Approval
approval.description: Voting and approval by the Chamber of Origin

revision.title: 5. Revision
revision.description: Review and voting by the Reviewing Chamber

promulgation.title: 6. Promulgation
promulgation.description: Publication and entry into force of the law

legislative.name: Legislative Branch
legislative.description: Creation of laws and oversight of government

judicial.name: Judicial Branch
judicial.description: Administration of justice and interpretation of laws

federal.name: Federal Government
federal.description: National government with specific constitutional powers

state.name: State Government
state.description: 32 federal entities with autonomy in their powers

municipal.name: Municipal Government
municipal.description: 2,469 municipalities as the basic unit of government

labels.selectItem: Select an item for more details

constitutional.title: Constitutional Law
constitutional.description: Studies the organization of the State and fundamental rights.

civil.title: Civil Law
civil.description: Regulates relationships between individuals, family, and property.

criminal.title: Criminal Law
criminal.description: Defines crimes and establishes corresponding penalties.

labor.title: Labor Law
labor.description: Regulates relationships between workers and employers.

tax.title: Tax Law
tax.description: Rules on taxes and tax obligations.

amparo.question: What is amparo?
amparo.answer: Amparo is a constitutional trial that protects fundamental rights against acts of authority.

federalVsState.question: What is the difference between federal and state law?
federalVsState.answer: Federal laws apply throughout the country, while state laws only apply in the state that issues them.

jurisprudence.question: What is jurisprudence?
jurisprudence.answer: These are mandatory criteria established by courts when resolving similar cases repeatedly.

official.title: Official Resources
official.supremeCourt: Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation

learning.title: Learning Path
learning.step1: Fundamentals of the Mexican legal system

normativeHierarchy.subordinationExplanation: This level must respect all provisions from levels 1 to {{level}}
normativeHierarchy.principleDescription: In the Mexican legal system, lower-level norms cannot contradict higher-level ones. Each level must respect and be aligned with all levels above it in the hierarchy.

constitution.characteristics: The Constitution is the supreme law that establishes the fundamental principles of the Mexican State, human rights, and the organization of public powers.

treaties.characteristics: International treaties signed and ratified by Mexico have constitutional rank in human rights matters and are hierarchically below the Constitution in other matters.

federalLaws.description: Laws enacted by the Federal Congress
federalLaws.characteristics: Laws issued by the Congress of the Union that apply throughout the national territory and regulate matters of federal competence.

stateConstitutions.characteristics: Each state has its own constitution that organizes local government and establishes rights, always respecting the Federal Constitution.

stateLaws.example2: Family Code of the State of Mexico
stateLaws.characteristics: Laws issued by state congresses that only apply within their territorial jurisdiction and regulate local matters.

regulations.example1: Regulation of the Federal Labor Law
regulations.example2: Regulation of the Income Tax Law
regulations.characteristics: Administrative norms issued by the Executive Branch that detail and specify how to apply laws, without exceeding or contradicting them.

norms.characteristics: Official Mexican Standards that establish technical specifications, procedures, and mandatory requirements in various matters.

legal.title: Mexican Legal System
legal.constitution: Political Constitution of the United Mexican States

requests.title: Document Requests
requests.subtitle: Request legal documents not yet in our corpus and vote for other users' requests.
requests.listSubtitle: Vote for the most important requests to prioritize their inclusion in LexMX
requests.noResultsDescription: Try adjusting filters or create a new request

commitment.title: Your privacy is our priority
commitment.content: LexMX operates completely in your browser. We do not collect, store, or process any personal data on external servers. Your legal queries, API tokens, and preferences remain exclusively on your device.

dataCollection.title: 1. Information we DO NOT collect
dataCollection.content: Unlike most online services, LexMX does not collect:

localStorage.title: 2. Local Storage
localStorage.content: LexMX uses browser local storage to improve your experience:
localStorage.local: Saves your preferences (theme, language) and AI provider settings.
localStorage.session: Temporarily stores encrypted API tokens during your session.
localStorage.indexed: Contains the legal corpus and vectors for offline search.
localStorage.clear: You can clear all this data at any time from your browser settings.

security.title: 3. Security
security.content: We implement multiple layers of security:
security.encryptionDesc: All API tokens are encrypted before storage
security.fingerprintingDesc: Tokens are linked to your specific device
security.noTransmissionDesc: Sensitive data never leaves your browser
security.openSourceDesc: You can audit our code on GitHub

thirdParty.title: 4. Third-party AI Providers
thirdParty.content: When using LexMX with AI providers (OpenAI, Claude, Gemini), your queries are sent directly from your browser to these services. LexMX never acts as an intermediary.
thirdParty.recommendation: Each provider has its own privacy policy. We recommend reviewing them before using their services.

hosting.title: 5. GitHub Pages
hosting.content: LexMX is hosted on GitHub Pages, which may collect basic technical information like IP addresses and user agents to prevent abuse. This information is not accessible to us. See

compliance.title: 6. Legal Compliance
compliance.lfpdppp: Federal Law on Protection of Personal Data Held by Private Parties (Mexico)

rights.title: 7. Your Rights
rights.content: Although we don't collect personal data, you have the right to:
rights.clear: Clear all local storage at any time
rights.use: Use LexMX without providing any personal information
rights.review: Review our source code to verify our practices

changes.title: 8. Changes to this Policy
changes.content: We may update this policy occasionally. Changes will be posted on this page with the update date. Since we don't collect contact information, we recommend checking this page periodically.

contact.title: 9. Contact
contact.content: If you have questions about this privacy policy:

sections.footer: This privacy policy is part of LexMX's commitment to transparency and protecting our users' privacy.

legal.title: Mexican Legal Codes
legal.subtitle: Access the complete corpus of updated Mexican legislation.
legal.disclaimer: Legal Notice: LexMX provides general legal information for educational purposes. It does not constitute professional legal advice. Always consult with a certified lawyer for specific cases.
legal.terms: By using this service, you accept our terms and conditions.
legal.copyright: © 2024 LexMX. Open source under MIT license.

base.role: You are a legal assistant specialized in Mexican law. Your function is to provide accurate and useful legal information about the Mexican legal system.
base.responseLanguage: IMPORTANT: You must ALWAYS respond in English, regardless of the language of the context documents or legal sources provided.

sources.constitution: Political Constitution of the United Mexican States
sources.federal: Current Mexican federal codes and laws
sources.jurisprudence: Jurisprudence from the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation

instructions.citation: Always cite specific articles and legal sources
instructions.references: Include references to jurisprudence when relevant
instructions.disclaimer: ALWAYS warn that this does not constitute professional legal advice
instructions.verification: Recommend verifying the currency of the information
instructions.clarity: Use clear but technically precise language

specializations.constitutional: SPECIALIZE in Mexican constitutional law, individual guarantees and amparo proceedings.
specializations.civil: SPECIALIZE in Mexican civil law, contracts, civil liability and property.
specializations.criminal: SPECIALIZE in Mexican criminal law, accusatory system and due process.
specializations.labor: SPECIALIZE in Mexican labor law, Federal Labor Law and social security.
specializations.tax: SPECIALIZE in Mexican tax law, tax obligations and fiscal procedures.
specializations.commercial: SPECIALIZE in Mexican commercial law, corporations, commerce and negotiable instruments.
specializations.administrative: SPECIALIZE in Mexican administrative law, administrative acts and state patrimonial liability.
specializations.family: SPECIALIZE in Mexican family law, marriage, divorce and parental authority.
specializations.familiar: SPECIALIZE in Mexican family law, marriage, divorce and parental authority.
specializations.property: SPECIALIZE in Mexican property law, real estate, possession and public registry.

queryTemplates.caseSummary:
Generate an executive summary of the following legal case.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Provide ONLY the summary content
- DO NOT include greetings, farewells, or personal comments
- DO NOT add phrases like "I hope this helps" or similar
- DO NOT use first person
- Be direct and professional

The summary must include:
1. **Current Status**: Concise description of the case and its state
2. **Involved Parties**: Who participates and their roles
3. **Key Documentation and Events**: Most important in chronological order
4. **Critical Deadlines**: Especially overdue or upcoming (mark with ⚠️ if overdue)
5. **Next Steps**: Recommended actions in order of priority
6. **Risks and Attention Points**: Aspects requiring immediate attention

{{query}}

Format: Use markdown with headers, lists, and bold text. Be concise and professional.

systemPrompts.legalWarning: ⚠️ This information is for educational purposes only and does not constitute professional legal advice. For specific cases, always consult with a certified lawyer.

citation: Verify the validity of the cited article
procedural: Verify specific requirements in the corresponding jurisdiction
Consult with a lawyer for complex cases
conceptual: Delve deeper into jurisprudence on the topic
